column33:

The RA and order number buttons/links are routerLinks and the analytics event emitter/function is attached to the links as click event handler. The problem is that the router handles the navigation away from the screen (thus unmounting the ReturnSummary component) before the click event is handled in the component.

column1: Order Lookup Page - Layout/Design Changes
column33:
h2. Story

As a guest user looking to find more information about an order I placed, I want an order lookup experience that gives me information about my entire order so that I know “where” the order is after it has been fulfilled. 

h2. Final Designs

[https://www.figma.com/file/RaDGnVHz6qYqyRTZtqDLyW/Order-Tracking?node-id=1433%3A52812|https://www.figma.com/file/RaDGnVHz6qYqyRTZtqDLyW/Order-Tracking?node-id=1433%3A52812|smart-link]

h2. Details

Issues

|*Link without a text alternative*
Links should always have a text alternative. The link text can be inserted into the HTML — it does not need to be visible to pass this check.|
|*Element IDs are not unique*
Two or more elements on this page have the same id value. These should be unique.|
|*Page zoom is restricted*
The viewport element on this page prevents users from zooming in or scaling text content.|
|*Color contrast is not sufficient*
Text on this page does not meet WCAG minimum color-contrast requirements.|
|*Skip to main content link is missing*
The first item reached by keyboard should be a link to the main content of the page. This link should be visible when receiving focus from the keyboard.|

*Recommendations*

|Provide a text alternative for the link|
|Make sure all id values are unique within the page|
|Allow text to be scaled to at least 200%.|
|Increase the color contrast to 4.5 or higher.|
|Add a "skip to main content" link at the top of the page. Make sure it's visible when receiving focus.|

column1: Develop form for single Return for customers making "contact CSA" return
column33:
h1. User Story

As a user starting a return online, I need to know exactly what information Zoro needs about my order so they can quickly process my return.

{color:#006644}*Goal: One email exchange Customer Experience returns; must include vital information for CSA to process returns.* {color}

h2. Approach

Guest customers experience remains unchanged. 

Left-hand-nav for CSAs duplicates existing CSA component

Fields for quantity, etc. may not exist in the creation of a new support request; will need to pass information into body of support request so CSA has the data. 



(Copied from Figma)

h3. Data:

In addition to these fields, Customer Service needs Order Number, email address, part number, category

The subject line we pass should be “Zoro Return Request for [insert Order#]

h3. Reason for Returning Field:

Return Reasons:

* Incorrect Item
* Ordered Incorrect Quantity
* Delivery Issue
* Damanged
* Found Lower Price
* No Longer Need
* Duplicate Order
* Warranty
* Hazmat DIF





h2. Design Guide

As a Zoro Customer Service agent, I need to have the following information in the first request to avoid unnecessary back and forth with the user.

* Order Number
* Reason code
* Item they want to return
* Quantity they want to return (if applicable) 
* -Replacement or- refund

Brainstorm some possibilities for how we can evolve our new journey from Order History to better support these two user types. (As a first step toward more online returns awareness we are sending items that are only eligible for a CS return to the default Contact Us form.) 

Create quick sketches or visuals to get the team thinking about what may or may not be possible. Share ideas.

When customers lookup their order using /Track-my-order page, they currently only see the Delivery status of their order based on the tracking number. This provides no detail regarding the order details itself, and no affordance to other self-serve order mgmt features like Returns.

However, we’re able to retrieve more helpful order details to the Track page. See Get-64 for order data retrieval. 

_Story:_ As a customer tracking their order, I want to view more details about my order so I can manage my order if I need to without having to go somewhere else.

How might we show the customer more details about their order including supporting the following intents:

# Can see multiple tracking statuses if there is more than one shipment per their order.
# Can view the order number, and items in the order, and relevant content for each item in the order (similar to Order History/Sales Order list.)
# Can initiate return at the line item level (similar to new Returns treatment).
# (Exploration) If item has not shipped allow for cancelation request.

column1: Refactor how order data is passed through props down from SalesOrderItems > SalesOrderItem > SalesOrderReturnButton
column33:
Issue: Starting in SalesOrderItems.ts.vue, the order object and one of the orders nested item objects defined as two different props, such that a prop referencing the order (which contains order item) and a prop referencing one of its items are passed down 3 levels of components in pararel.

Why it needs fixin': 1) Creates complexity by default; 2) obscures the flow of data and relations between involved components; 3) inherently confusing for developers working with these files; 4) There are unit tests written for 3 component that have to be maintained which are testing these orderItem and order props each separately.; 5) Performance?

column1: [ADA2] Order History - Returns review
column33:
*This description is no longer relevant due to vuetification. See comments below for current.*

Order History - Returns page using the SiteImprove plugin, and document any issues aligning to AA compliance level in the [ADA2 BGM Audit|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1_8XFqRoNJ7omOsz9SzzuLM7AzGldZhxrzKk6nqsuoeY/edit?usp=sharing].

*Issues*

|*Button without a text alternative*
Buttons should always have a text label. The label can be inserted into the HTML — it does not need to be visible to pass this check.|
|*Visible label and accessible name do not match*
The accessible name of any interactive element should contain its visible text label.|
|*State or property not supported*
An ARIA attribute has been specified that not supported by this type of element.|
|*Element IDs are not unique*
Two or more elements on this page have the same id value. These should be unique.|
|*Page region without an accessible name*
Any page section with the role of region should also have an accessible name to identify it.|
|*Text not included in an ARIA landmark*
All perceivable text content should be included in an ARIA landmarkhttps://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/examples/landmarks/index.html opens in a new window.
Perceivable text content refers to text that can be perceived by users of assistive technology — some of which may be invisible to sighted users.|
|*Links are not clearly identifiable*
Color alone is not enough to distinguish a link from the surrounding text.|
|*Scrollable element is not keyboard accessible*
This page has a scrollable section that can't be operated by keyboard.|
|*Issue:* Product images contain links that do not have a text alternative. There is no text inside <a>, and no alt or aria.
*Compliancy recommendations:* Use aria-hide and tab index to make it so there is no keyboard focus.|

*Recommendations*

|Make sure all id values are unique within the page.|
|Provide an accessible name for the region.|
|Ensure all perceivable text is included in an ARIA landmark.|
|Add a secondary visual identifier for links.|
|Make sure that the element can be reached by keyboard.|

column1: [ADA2] Sign In | Register page review
column33:
*** Only ADA issues found were for global search field (outside of scope of ticket) and duplicate ids for script tags (to be ignored). See comments for screenshot.*

\[Sign In | Register|https://www.zoro.com/sign-in/login] page using the SiteImprove plugin, and document any issues aligning to AA compliance level in the [Vue BGM accessibility audit spreadsheet|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kW_XThWHYuT1PcT_QYV3vAZxaDMtBodAdwUtsTc8Ah8/edit?usp=sharing].

*Issues*

|*Visible label and accessible name do not match*
The accessible name of any interactive element should contain its visible text label.|
|*State or property not supported*
An ARIA attribute has been specified that not supported by this type of element.|
|*Element IDs are not unique*
Two or more elements on this page have the same id value. These should be unique.|
|*Page region without an accessible name*
Any page section with the role of region should also have an accessible name to identify it.|
|*Role not inside the required context*
This page element has a role that only makes sense in the context of another role.|
|*Text not included in an ARIA landmark*
All perceivable text content should be included in an [+ARIA landmark+|https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/examples/landmarks/index.html] opens in a new window.
Perceivable text content refers to text that can be perceived by users of assistive technology — some of which may be invisible to sighted users.|
|*Links are not clearly identifiable*
Color alone is not enough to distinguish a link from the surrounding text.|
|*Container element is empty*
Some roles are designed to contain other roles. This element has this type of role, but it doesn't contain any required-owned elementshttps://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/#mustContain opens in a new window.|
|*Form field is not labeled*
Every form element should have a descriptive text label.|
|*Scrollable element is not keyboard accessible*
This page has a scrollable section that can't be operated by keyboard.|

*Recommendations*

|Include the label text in the accessible name of the element.|
|Use supported states and properties only.|
|Make sure all id values are unique within the page.|
|Provide an accessible name for the region.|
|Make sure the element is contained by another element that has the required context role.|
|Ensure all perceivable text is included in an ARIA landmark.|
|Add a secondary visual identifier for links.|
|Make sure required-owned elements are nested correctly under the context-giving element.|
|Add a label, making sure it's properly associated with the form field.|
|Make sure that the element can be reached by keyboard.|
